Name: Harrison Ginsberg’s Martinez
Intro: A split base of sweet Old Tom and crisp London dry gins differentiates this Martinez from the classic Old Tom–only version. While similar to a Martini, this drink is somewhat richer, Harrison Ginsberg notes. “It could be an aperitif, a digestif,” he says. “It’s one of those cocktails that could go both ways.”
Recipe:
Harrison Ginsberg’s Martinez
from Punch (http://punchdrink.com)

Ingredients
Serving: 1


                        1 1/2 ounces sweet vermouth, preferably Carpano Antica
                    

                                                    1 1/2 ounces sweet vermouth, preferably Carpano Antica
                                            

                        1 ounce London dry gin, preferably Tanqueray
                    

                                                    1 ounce London dry gin, preferably Tanqueray
                                            

                        1 ounce Old Tom gin, preferably Porter’s Tropical
                    

                                                    1 ounce Old Tom gin, preferably Porter’s Tropical
                                            

                        1 teaspoon maraschino liqueur, preferably Bordiga
                    

                                                    1 teaspoon maraschino liqueur, preferably Bordiga
                                            

                        2 dashes Angostura bitters
                    

                                                    2 dashes Angostura bitters
                                            


Garnish: lemon twist

Directions

Stir all ingredients with ice.
Strain into a Nick & Nora glass or small coupe.
Garnish with the lemon twist.
